data:
{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3415974,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-16T18:58:18.775Z","cooked":"

Our team has used VexPro VersaFrame pre-drilled tubing for many years now and have developed an ecosystem around it, where we can use 8-32 screws where we need to through-bolt something, or tap the existing holes to 10-32, use rivets, or just drill them out if we need another fastener. Granted, this only works on thick-wall stock, and the tapped 10-32 holes aren’t the strongest (due to the stock only being 0.1" thick), but it’s worked for us.

I’ve looked at a lot of the pre-drilled stock options that other vendors have come out with more recently, but have avoided them primarily because they all seem to be drilled for 0.201" holes (or larger), which would make them too big for 8-32s to fit well, and also impossible to tap for 10-32 (requiring rivnuts or through-bolting with locknuts). Recently, it seems even the latest versions of the VexPro stock has gone this way too, leaving us in a difficult position as we plan to restock supplies for the upcoming season.

Is anyone aware of a vendor that still sells pre-drilled aluminum tubing stock with smaller holes (~0.163")? I know there’s been a bunch of new FRC suppliers in recent years, so I’m kind of hoping I just missed one of them or something. While we do have a CNC mill/router, I’m not confident we could reach the level of accuracy/consistency that we’d be happy with, plus not to mention the incredible amount of time and effort it would take for the amount of stock we like to buy.

Maybe @rv_l123 can shed some light as to if it can be done?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-08-16T19:08:02.460Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":431,"readers_count":430,"score":96.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469939,"topic_slug":"is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes","display_username":"David B","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39555,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"David, Mentor FRC 6004/4795"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes/469939/2","custom_user_title":"David, Mentor FRC 6004/4795","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3415981,"name":"Marshall Hamon","username":"Zekrim","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/b487fb/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-16T19:15:02.317Z","cooked":"

This isn’t a solution, but if you don’t find something else that works you can use rivet-nuts to add threaded holes to something larger than the screw’s tap diameter. It adds another step to the process, but rivet nuts let you thread into thin stock as well as thick stock (and their threads usually last longer)

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-08-16T19:15:02.317Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":414,"readers_count":413,"score":97.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469939,"topic_slug":"is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes","display_username":"Marshall Hamon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48651,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes/469939/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3415982,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-16T19:17:20.830Z","cooked":"

We have used rivet nuts before on occasion when we had a stripped-out hole or knew a connection needed more reinforcement, but it’s not really something I want to do for every single connection point (plus there’s a weight penalty once you add enough of them.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-08-16T19:17:20.830Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":408,"readers_count":407,"score":81.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469939,"topic_slug":"is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48651,"username":"Zekrim","name":"Marshall Hamon","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/b487fb/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes/469939/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3415985,"name":"Domtech","username":"Domtech","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domtech/{size}/138487_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-16T19:27:45.070Z","cooked":"
cbale2000:

Is anyone aware of a vendor that still sells pre-drilled aluminum tubing stock with smaller holes (~0.163")?

It seems like WCP still sells tubes with this hole size (1" sides only).
I found them on these two pages:

WestCoast Products

Elevator Components

Elevators can be more effective at lifting objects than arms because they don’t move the object further away from the robot while lifting. The tradeoff in performance comes with complexity, and often this has kept many teams from making elevator...

Price: USD 49.99

WestCoast Products

Arm Components

Arms are the go-to, simple mechanism for moving objects in FRC, yet despite being one of the simplest mechanisms out there, it’s sometimes hard to find everything you need to build an arm all in one place. Making an arm is easy, and we’ll show you...

Price: USD 7.99

I’m not sure if they plan to continue selling these in the future since most teams and vendors are standardizing on #10-32 (+ 3/16 rivets) and getting rid of #8-32 screws.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-08-16T19:28:33.544Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":390,"readers_count":389,"score":83.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469939,"topic_slug":"is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes","display_username":"Domtech","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://wcproducts.com/products/elevator-components","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Elevator Components – WestCoast Products","clicks":9},{"url":"https://wcproducts.com/collections/systems-structure/products/arm-components-1","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Arm Components – WestCoast Products","clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14045,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes/469939/5","custom_user_title":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3415991,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-16T19:33:57.384Z","cooked":"

I’m pretty sure the drawing they provide for those parts is outdated, the part number and description don’t appear to match (seems like it’s a drawing from back when WCP was selling Vex stuff), and the holes appear to be larger in the pictures too.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-08-16T19:33:57.384Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":345,"readers_count":344,"score":74.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469939,"topic_slug":"is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14045,"username":"Domtech","name":"Domtech","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domtech/{size}/138487_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes/469939/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3415998,"name":"Rahul Yarlagadda","username":"Knufire","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/knufire/{size}/67820_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-16T19:47:28.549Z","cooked":"
cbale2000:

we can use 8-32 screws where we need to through-bolt something

You might generally be out of luck here, while VexPro system standardized on mostly 8/32 or 5/32" hardware (likely due to already being tooled up for that size with VEX EDR) most other product lines in FRC have been standardized on #10 or 3/16". As VexPro seems to be scaling back their offerings I think it will generally be harder and harder to find FRC structure components that prioritize compatibility with #8. I think you’d be better served moving up a hardware size in the long term.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-08-16T19:47:28.549Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":333,"readers_count":332,"score":141.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469939,"topic_slug":"is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes","display_username":"Rahul Yarlagadda","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7457 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes/469939/7","custom_user_title":"7457 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416000,"name":"Domtech","username":"Domtech","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domtech/{size}/138487_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-16T19:52:14.974Z","cooked":"

Yeah, I think you are right. It’s only one of the drawings that shows the older size, but the part number is wrong. The models and pictures are the newer version.

It’s looking like drilling you own is probably the only option now.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-08-16T19:52:14.974Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":310,"readers_count":309,"score":62.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469939,"topic_slug":"is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes","display_username":"Domtech","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6560,"username":"cbale2000","name":"Chris Bale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14045,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes/469939/8","custom_user_title":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"cry","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416002,"name":"Benjamin Nadolsky","username":"BWJN","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bwjn/{size}/208649_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-16T19:59:09.275Z","cooked":"

Hmm, I’ll raise this topic with our team!

As others have mentioned, the #10-32 standard is what we have been following to make it easier for teams.

However, if there is a contingent of teams who prefer #8-32, we are happy to explore the potential options, even if it were say a group buy as opposed to a more routinely stocked offering.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-08-16T19:59:09.275Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":297,"readers_count":296,"score":74.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469939,"topic_slug":"is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes","display_username":"Benjamin Nadolsky","primary_group_name":"LastAnvil","flair_name":"LastAnvil","flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":61,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":39555,"username":"David_IsMe","name":"David B","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/david_isme/{size}/196853_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62631,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"www.lastanvil.com (Pulleys, End Caps, and More!)"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes/469939/9","custom_user_title":"www.lastanvil.com (Pulleys, End Caps, and More!)","reactions":[{"id":"call_me_hand","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416050,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-17T00:24:58.639Z","cooked":"

Vex still sell it…

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-08-17T00:24:58.639Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":249,"readers_count":248,"score":54.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469939,"topic_slug":"is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes/469939/10","custom_user_title":"2974 Robot Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416066,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-17T02:05:17.048Z","cooked":"

If you check the webpage, the original VersaFrame Tube stock came in 0.04" and 0.1" thick varieties and was sold under the part numbers 217-3453 and 217-4104 (amongst others) with the 0.163" pre-drilled holes.

The current stock is sold as 0.0625" and 0.125" thick varieties and part numbers 217-8714 and 217-8730 (and marketed as “v2”). When you look at the drawings for those parts, they show the holes as 0.201".

They DO still appear to still sell C and L channel and plastic tube stock using the smaller hole pattern, and the drawing page on their website appears to default load an outdated drawing of the thin-wall 1"x1" tube stock, but that seems to be just because they didn’t update that on the website.

Unless I’m just blind and there’s somewhere I’m not looking (entirely possible).

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-08-17T02:40:47.419Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":243,"readers_count":242,"score":48.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469939,"topic_slug":"is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://content.vexrobotics.com/vexpro/pdf/PreDrilled-TubeStock-011223.pdf","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":3},{"url":"https://www.vexrobotics.com/versaframestock.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":15944,"username":"FrankJ","name":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes/469939/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416075,"name":"Totally out of touch","username":"AdamHeard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adamheard/{size}/195262_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-17T03:05:02.486Z","cooked":"

The solution is to take all your #8-32’s and put them in the garbage where they belong.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-08-17T03:05:02.486Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":222,"readers_count":221,"score":319.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469939,"topic_slug":"is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes","display_username":"Totally out of touch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":18}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3609,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes/469939/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":16},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"cry","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":24,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416081,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-17T03:35:25.972Z","cooked":"

Honestly, I’m less attached to the 8-32s (though we do probably have over $1000 of them kicking around, and they are lighter than 10-32s if you add them up over a whole robot) than I am the ability to tap hole for 10-32s, which is legitimately extremely convenient, especially since the threads on the next biggest size (1/4-20s) are not well suited to tapping into thin aluminum.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-08-17T03:35:25.972Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":215,"readers_count":214,"score":63.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469939,"topic_slug":"is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":3609,"username":"AdamHeard","name":"Totally out of touch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adamheard/{size}/195262_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/is-there-anywhere-you-can-still-get-aluminum-tubing-with-0-2-pre-drilled-holes/469939/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"call_me_hand","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416083,"name":"","username":"AVHon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/avhon/{size}/130071_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-17T04:06:34.991Z","cooked":"

The next biggest size is #12 (outside diameter 0.2160 inches). Both it and 1/4-inch bolts are available in a standard fine pitch of 28 threads per inch, which still gives over three full turns of engagement in 1/8" material.

en.wikipedia.org

Unified Thread Standard

The Unified Thread Standard (UTS) defines a standard thread form and series—along with allowances, tolerances, and designations—for screw threads commonly used in the United States and Canada. It is the main standard for bolts, nuts, and a wide variety of other threaded fasteners used in these countries. It has the same 60° profile as the ISO metric screw thread, but the characteristic dimensions of each UTS thread (outer diameter and pitch) were chosen as an inch fraction rather than a millime...

edit: actually, the 0.201 hole standard is almost perfect for 12-24 or 12-28 thread-forming taps. (Sources differ on exactly the right drill sizes; here are two.) It’s close enough that you can probably just go right in to thin aluminum without any drilling. Thread-forming taps don’t make chips, so you don’t have to worry about keeping the part and its surroundings clean, and you also don’t have to worry about backing the tap up periodically to break and clear chips.

I’m seeing a pretty simple solution to this problem:
Standardize to metric and use M4x0.7 bolts (which require 3.3mm holes). M4 tap is really close to M3 clearance (0.1mm difference).
Then we can also switch to 25x50 tubing in thicknesses ranging between 1mm (close to 1/32") to 4mm (close to 0.15")!
As a side benefit, no more conversion issues when sending a NASA Rover to Mars!

AVHon:

The next biggest size is #12 (outside diameter 0.2160 inches). Both it and 1/4-inch bolts are available in a standard fine pitch of 28 threads per inch, which still gives over three full turns of engagement in 1/8" material.

Sorry, I should have been more specific and said “The next biggest common size”. 12-28 screws are significantly less common, have less variety, and are far more expensive. 12-24s are a bit better, but still lack variety and the larger threads defeat the purpose.

gellnick:

I’m seeing a pretty simple solution to this problem:
Standardize to metric and use M4x0.7 bolts (which require 3.3mm holes).

Eww, gross…

The drill size for 1/4-28 is just a bit bigger (0.215") than the standard 0.201" holes, but it may be reasonable to push a hand tap through that in thin aluminum. Otherwise, one of those drill taps would definitely go right through in one operation.

cbale2000:

they all seem to be drilled for 0.201" holes (or larger)

To be pedantic, all of the available COTS punched tube available right now have 0.196”/#9/5mm holes in it, not the #7 (0.201”) holes you described.
